page.title: 12TRAFFIC SURVEY (PART 1)
page.content: We did a traffic Survey in Bishopthorpe Village. One group did an experiment to see how good a blind person was at detecting vehicles. Lorries were easy to pick out, but some cars were very difficult. Another group looked at makes of cars. Those made by Ford were the most popular, and blue cars werre seen most frequently, closely followed by red. Another person found that Bedford was the most popular make of truck. The busiest road was found to be Main Street, closely followed by Sim Balk Lane. Appleton Road was the quietist road. The traffic flow in and out of the village was also studied. Peak movement out was between 8.00am and 8.30am and movement in, 5.30 to 6.30pm.
